LiveAction.description: Container that wraps form controls and executes SQL mutations on submit. Children can use {{fieldName}} bindings in the SQL that get replaced with form values.
LiveAction.example:
<LiveAction sql="UPDATE tasks SET status = {{status}} WHERE id = 1">
  <Select name="status" options={[{value: "done", label: "Done"}]} />
  <Button>Update</Button>
</LiveAction>

Button.description: Button that triggers the parent LiveAction's SQL execution on click. Must be used inside a LiveAction container.
Button.example:
<LiveAction sql="UPDATE tasks SET done = true WHERE id = 1">
  <Button>Mark Complete</Button>
</LiveAction>

Checkbox.description: Checkbox that registers its value with parent LiveAction for SQL binding. The `name` prop determines the {{name}} placeholder in SQL (returns true/false).
Checkbox.example:
<LiveAction sql="UPDATE tasks SET done = {{done}} WHERE id = 1">
  <Checkbox name="done">Mark as complete</Checkbox>
  <Button>Save</Button>
</LiveAction>

Select.description: Dropdown select that registers its value with parent LiveAction for SQL binding. The `name` prop determines the {{name}} placeholder in SQL.
Select.example:
<LiveAction sql="UPDATE tasks SET status = {{status}} WHERE id = 1">
  <Select
    name="status"
    options={[
      { value: "pending", label: "Pending" },
      { value: "done", label: "Done" }
    ]}
  />
  <Button>Update</Button>
</LiveAction>

Textarea.description: Multiline text input that registers its value with parent LiveAction for SQL binding. The `name` prop determines the {{name}} placeholder in SQL.
Textarea.example:
<LiveAction sql="UPDATE posts SET content = {{content}} WHERE id = 1">
  <Textarea name="content" placeholder="Enter content..." rows={5} />
  <Button>Save</Button>
</LiveAction>

Input.description: Text input with optional masking and automatic validation.
Input.example:
<Input name="email" label="Email" placeholder="you@example.com" />
<Input name="phone" label="Phone" mask="phone" />
<Input name="card" label="Card" mask="creditCard" />
<Input name="amount" label="Amount" mask="currency" />

Tabs.description: Tabbed navigation for organizing content into switchable panels. Use for dashboards, settings pages, or any content that benefits from tab navigation.
Tabs.example:
<Tabs defaultValue="overview">
  <Tab value="overview" label="Overview">Overview content here</Tab>
  <Tab value="metrics" label="Metrics">Metrics and charts</Tab>
  <Tab value="settings" label="Settings">Configuration options</Tab>
</Tabs>

Loader.description: Animated loading indicator with multiple visual styles. Supports spinner, dots, bars, pulse, ring, bounce, wave, and square variants.

Progress.description: Progress bar for displaying completion status or loading states. Supports determinate (with value) and indeterminate (loading) modes.
Progress.example:
<Progress value={75} />
<Progress value={45} label="Upload Progress" showValue />
<Progress indeterminate />

LiveValue.description: Displays live SQL query results. Auto-selects display format based on data shape: inline (1×1), list (N×1), or table (N×M). Supports template mode with {{field}} bindings.
LiveValue.example:
<LiveValue sql="SELECT count(*) FROM users" />
<LiveValue sql="SELECT name FROM users" display="list" />
<LiveValue sql="SELECT * FROM tasks WHERE status = 'active'" display="table" />

AreaChart.description: Area chart for visualizing trends with filled regions. Supports stacking for comparing cumulative values.
AreaChart.example:
<AreaChart data={data} xKey="date" yKey="pageviews" />
<AreaChart data={data} xKey="month" yKey={["revenue", "costs"]} stacked />

BarChart.description: Bar chart for comparing categorical data. Supports vertical/horizontal orientation and stacked bars.
BarChart.example:
<BarChart data={data} xKey="category" yKey="value" />
<BarChart data={data} xKey="month" yKey={["sales", "costs"]} stacked />

PieChart.description: Pie/donut chart for showing proportional data. Set innerRadius > 0 to create a donut chart.
PieChart.example:
<PieChart data={data} valueKey="count" nameKey="category" />
<PieChart data={data} valueKey="amount" nameKey="type" innerRadius={60} />

LineChart.description: Line chart for visualizing trends over time or continuous data. Works standalone or inside LiveValue for live SQL data.
LineChart.example:
<LineChart data={data} xKey="date" yKey="revenue" />
<LineChart data={data} xKey="month" yKey={["sales", "expenses"]} showLegend />

Metric.description: KPI display for showing a single metric value with optional label and change indicator. Perfect for dashboards. Can consume data from parent LiveValue context or use direct value prop.
Metric.example:
<Metric label="Total Users" value={1234} />
<Metric label="Revenue" value={50000} prefix="$" change={12.5} />

// With LiveValue data context:
<LiveValue query="SELECT SUM(amount) as value FROM orders">
  <Metric label="Total Revenue" prefix="$" />
</LiveValue>

Alert.description: Callout message box for displaying info, warnings, errors, or success messages. Use to highlight important information or feedback to users.
Alert.example:
<Alert>This is an informational message.</Alert>
<Alert variant="success" title="Success!">Your changes have been saved.</Alert>
<Alert variant="warning">Please review before continuing.</Alert>
<Alert variant="destructive" title="Error">Something went wrong.</Alert>

Block.description: Embeds reusable MDX blocks inline, or creates new ones with AI assistance. Supports embedding from pages/blocks/, inline editing, and AI generation.
Block.example:
<Block src="blocks/header" />
<Block src="blocks/user-card" params={{userId: 123}} />
<Block editing prompt="create a metrics card" />

Badge.description: Inline status indicator for labeling items with semantic colors. Use for status indicators, tags, or category labels.

Kanban.description: Drag-and-drop Kanban board that displays data grouped by a column. Cards can be dragged between columns to update the underlying data. Must be wrapped in a LiveValue to receive data. REQUIRED: groupByColumn (column to group by), cardTitleField (field for card title). OPTIONAL: fixedColumns (always show these columns in order, filter data to match), columnOrder (explicit column order + extras from data), cardFields (additional fields on cards), idField (primary key, default 'id'), updateSql (auto-generated from parent query if not provided).
Kanban.example:
<LiveValue query="SELECT id, title, status FROM tasks">
  <Kanban groupByColumn="status" cardTitleField="title" fixedColumns={["todo", "in_progress", "done"]} />
</LiveValue>

DataGrid.description: High-performance editable data grid with virtualization, keyboard navigation, and comprehensive cell editing. Supports sorting, searching, and clipboard operations.
DataGrid.example:
<DataGrid data={data} />
<DataGrid data={data} height={400} readOnly />
<DataGrid data={data} columns={[{key: "name", label: "Name"}, {key: "email", label: "Email"}]} />
